project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Land Managment I Project - Parana are to increase agricultural production and farm incomes. To accomplish this the project will be composed of the following components: (i) adaptive research, focusing on improved soil cover and structure; (ii) rural extension, using both public and private extension services; (iii) financial assistance to microcatchment farmer associations; and (iv) erosion control works along rural roads to reduce erosion in microcatchments. Further to this the project will finance; (v) rail terminal facilities to reduce transport costs of lime; (vi) commercial and conservation forestry and environmental studies; (vii) land use monitoring and control; (viii) project administration, monitoring and evaluation; and (ix) training.
